ygData.subject: RE: Cheats, bannable offenses, and the like
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey hey, I can see what your saying, but true cheats are so uncommon in EQ, that it s odd when you actually see one (especially a new one). Alot of us are used
ygData.messageBody:
Hey hey, I can see what your saying, but true cheats are so uncommon in EQ,
that it's odd when you actually see one (especially a new one). Alot of us
are used to UO where cheats where common, you rarely got found out, and the
GMs were so overworked they didn't give a shit when you used em. It's NOT
the same thing here, from what I can tell.

And, the trapping thing can and will get you banned. People will petition
your ass and a GM WILL come (I petitioned one guy that pissed me off - AND
was trapping - and a GM was there inside of 20 minutes).

AND, I see your point. I for one will not be responding to emails saying
stupid shit like "Hey you stupid shit, that's a cheat! That'll get you
banned!" HA! This is a little insane! I get it now!

Thanks!

-Leod

-----Original Message-----
From: Moe Drippins [mailto:ug@...]
Sent: Monday, August 16, 1999 4:33 PM
To: eqcheats@onelist.com
Subject: [EQCheats] Cheats, bannable offenses, and the like


From: Moe Drippins <ug@...>


All,

It seems every time that someone posts a cheat that might be frowned
upon by the GM's, numerous people feel the need to chime in that it
might be frowned upon by the GM's.

I know you all mean well, but this *IS* a cheat list, and it's a bit
tiring to get 5 emails about the dangers of doing "X" for every mail
that we get about "X".

Might I suggest that the owner of this list put that disclaimer at the
bottom of the list or make it part of the "Hello, welcome to EQ
cheats..." subscription notice?

Just one man's opinion.

--
Frake, Rodcet Nife
Iilii, Vallon Zek
